bookings_service package

bookings_service.database module

bookings_service.database.get_db()[source]

bookings_service.main module

Bookings Service

This module defines the FastAPI service responsible for managing room bookings in the Smart Meeting Room system. It exposes endpoints to create, list, retrieve, update, and delete bookings.

class bookings_service.main.BookingCreate(*, room_id: int, username: str, start_time: datetime, end_time: datetime, purpose: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: BaseModel

Schema for creating a new booking.

Type:

Start datetime of the booking.

Type:

datetime.datetime

end_time

End datetime of the booking (must be after start_time).

Type:

datetime.datetime

purpose

Optional free-text description of the meeting purpose.

Type:

str | None

bookings_service.main.create_booking(payload: BookingCreate) → BookingResponse[source]

Create a new booking.

Validates that the end time is strictly after the start time, then stores the booking in the in-memory list.

Parameters:

payload – BookingCreate object containing room, user, time range, and optional purpose.

Returns:

The created booking including its generated identifier and status.

Return type:

BookingResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the time interval is invalid (end before or equal to start).

bookings_service.main.delete_booking(booking_id: int) → dict[source]

Cancel (delete) an existing booking.

Parameters:

booking_id – Identifier of the booking to delete.

Returns:

A confirmation message containing the identifier of the deleted booking.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the booking does not exist.

bookings_service.main.get_booking(booking_id: int) → BookingResponse[source]

Retrieve a single booking by its identifier.

Parameters:

booking_id – Identifier of the booking to retrieve.

Returns:

The matching booking.

Return type:

BookingResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the booking does not exist.

bookings_service.main.get_booking_or_404(booking_id: int) → BookingResponse[source]

Retrieve a booking by its identifier or raise a 404 error.

Parameters:

booking_id – Unique identifier of the booking to retrieve.

Returns:

The matching booking object.

Return type:

BookingResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If no booking exists with the given identifier.

bookings_service.main.list_bookings() → List[BookingResponse][source]

List all bookings currently stored in the system.

Returns:

A list of all bookings.

Return type:

List[BookingResponse]

bookings_service.main.update_booking(booking_id: int, payload: BookingUpdate) → BookingResponse[source]

Update an existing booking.

Allows changing the start time, end time, and/or purpose while ensuring that the resulting time interval remains valid.

Parameters:

  • booking_id – Identifier of the booking to update.

  • payload – BookingUpdate object with new values for the booking.

Returns:

The updated booking.

Return type:

BookingResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the updated time interval is invalid or the booking does not exist.
